snippet: Even before a tornado tore through this small southern Illinois city, killing six people, Harrisburg had seen trouble. And they have had to rebuild, over and over.
abstract: Harrisburg, Ill, will have to rebuild yet again after tornado tears through, killing six people, and leaving others cowering inside closets, huddling under mattresses showered with glass, metal and wood, and hiding inside bathtubs; community has been recovering from floods and ice storms and now residents have a new hurdle to overcome.

byline.contributor: Emma G. Fitzsimmons contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Even before a tornado tore through this small southern Illinois city, killing six people, Harrisburg had seen trouble. And they have had to rebuild, over and over.

headline.seo: Southern Illinois Town Is All Too Versed in Taking a Hit
headline.main: Illinois Town All Too Versed in Taking a Hit
headline.print_headline: Town in Illinois All Too Versed In Taking a Hit
